column4: Further promising data seen with Biogen Alzheimer's drug: study
column5: Gradually increasing the dose of Biogen Inc's experimental Alzheimer's disease drug appeared to reduce the risk of brain swelling compared to higher fixed doses  interim 12-month results from a small study released on Thursday showed.

column4: Ex-Insys executives arrested for bribing U.S. doctors to prescribe painkiller
column5: Six former Insys Therapeutics Inc executives and managers were arrested on Thursday on charges they engaged in a nationwide scheme to bribe doctors to unnecessarily prescribe a drug containing the opioid fentanyl  U.S. prosecutors said.

column4: Peet's expanding roasting capacity amid premium coffee boom
column5: Peet's Coffee & Tea  a longtime rival to Starbucks Corp   said on Friday it will invest $58 million to open a new coffee roasting facility in Suffolk  Virginia  to support its expanding business in an increasingly competitive environment.

column4: Synergy Pharma's irritable bowel drug succeeds in key study
column5: Synergy Pharmaceuticals Inc said its experimental once-daily tablet  plecanatide  met the main goal of a late-stage study on irritable bowel syndrome patients with constipation (IBS-C)  according to an analysis of preliminary data.

column4: 3M to sell identity management business to Gemalto
column5: 3M Co   the maker of Scotch tape and Post-it notes  said it had entered into agreements to sell its identity management business to Amsterdam-based digital security company Gemalto  for $850 million.

column4: Apollo-backed annuity service provider Athene jumps in IPO debut
column5: Shares of Athene Holding Ltd  jumped as much as 9.2 percent in their debut on Friday  valuing the fixed annuity service provider at about $8.25 billion in the year's largest financial IPO.

column4: AstraZeneca's immunotherapy enters U.S. approval process
column5: FRANKFURT AstraZeneca's immunotherapy drug durvalumab  the British drugmaker's most important pipeline medicine  has been accepted for review by U.S. regulators against bladder cancer  potentially its first use.

column4: U.S. regulator to fail Santander on community lending: sources
column5: WASHINGTON A U.S. bank regulator is poised to fault Spanish lender Banco Santander SA   for doing too little to reach poor neighborhoods and will fail the bank on a test of community lending  according to sources familiar with the situation.

column4: Coke CEO Muhtar Kent hands reins to Quincey in widely expected move
column5: Coca-Cola Co said on Friday that Muhtar Kent would step aside as chief executive next year and be replaced by James Quincey  a company veteran credited with several recent changes to help the company cut its dependence on sugary drinks. |Â Video

column4: Credit Suisse lowers hurdle to redeem delisted oil ETNs
column5: NEW YORK Credit Suisse on Friday said it would lower investors' hurdle to redeeming two popular exchange-traded notes  used to bet on the price of oil  after it delisted the products in a surprise move this week.

column4: McDonald's to move international tax base to UK amid EU scrutiny
column5: (Story corrects paragraph 10 to replace U.S. drugmaker Allegion with U.S. lock maker Allegion)

column4: Washington state sues Monsanto over PCB damages  cleanup costs
column5: Washington state filed an environmental lawsuit on Thursday against agricultural company Monsanto Co seeking damages and cleanup costs associated with the company's production of PCBs  the state's attorney general said.

column4: Exclusive: Blackstone-backed hedge fund offers to buy NorthStar Realty Europe
column5: A major shareholder of NorthStar Realty Europe Corp  has offered to buy the company for $13 per share and is demanding that the real estate investment trust (REIT) pursue a new asset management contract  according to a letter seen by Reuters.

column4: No forced layoffs in Germany by 2021 if Linde  Praxair merge: union
column5: FRANKFURT Labor unions have secured guarantees for a planned merger of Linde  and U.S. rival Praxair   saying on Friday there would be no forced layoffs at Linde in Germany until Dec. 31  2021 in case of a tie-up.

column4: U.S. decision on Polish Patriot deal seen in coming months: agency
column5: WARSAW Poland may be granted U.S. government export approval to buy eight Patriot missile defence systems from Raytheon Co  within the next few months  a senior Raytheon official told a Polish news agency on Friday.

column4: South Africa's Sibanye pays $2.2 billion for Stillwater in U.S. move
column5: JOHANNESBURG South Africa's Sibanye Gold took a major step outside its home market on Friday with a $2.2 billion deal to buy Stillwater Mining  the only U.S. miner of platinum and palladium.

column4: Blackstone prepares to list European warehouse firm Logicor
column5: LONDON/FRANKFURT Buyout fund Blackstone is hiring banks to prepare for an initial public offering (IPO) of its warehouse firm Logicor  several people with knowledge of the situation said.

column4: Time Inc hires bankers to explore takeover  partnership interest: WSJ
column5: (Corrects Dec. 8 story to say in paragraph 8 that Leonard Blavatnik is a Russian-born American billionaire  not a Russian billionaire)

column4: American Airlines raises fourth-quarter unit revenue forecast
column5: American Airlines Group Inc  said higher average fares per mile have boosted its revenue and profit expectations for the fourth quarter  a day after rival United Continental Holdings Inc  also raised forecasts.

column4: Zimmer Biomet to settle bribery charges with U.S. prosecutors: filing
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. authorities will reach a settlement with medical device maker Zimmer Biomet Holdings Inc over bribery allegations in the next four weeks  prosecutors said in a court filing Thursday.
